alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 31 at 7:05PM MST until August 31 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 704 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles south of Kearny to 16 miles southeast of Coolidge Airport to near La Palma to near Chui-Chu to 9 miles east of Kaka, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 149 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 210 and 219. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 123 and 161. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 42 and 44. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. AZ Route 347 between mile markers 161 and 184. This includes AZ Interstate 10 between 168 and 204. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, San Tan Valley, Seville, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Bapchule, and Olberg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
